Accessibility.question: What does 'WCAG' stand for in web accessibility?
What does ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) help with in web development?
What is the purpose of alt text in HTML images for accessibility?
Accessibility.choice3: To hide the image from screen readers
Accessibility.choice4: To provide a text alternative for screen readers

Accessibility.question: Which HTML element defines the structure of a web document?
What is the purpose of semantic HTML elements in web accessibility?
Accessibility.choice1: To add decorative elements to a webpage
Accessibility.choice2: To provide meaning and structure to content
Accessibility.choice4: To block certain content from screen readers

Accessibility.question: What does 'keyboard accessibility' refer to in web development?
Accessibility.choice2: Making websites accessible via keyboard navigation
Accessibility.choice4: Developing software for hardware keyboards only

Accessibility.question: What is the purpose of skip navigation links in web accessibility?
Accessibility.choice1: To navigate to the top of a webpage
Accessibility.choice2: To skip past repeated content and directly access main content

Accessibility.question: What is the recommended color contrast ratio for text and its background for better readability?
What does 'focus management' involve in web accessibility?
Accessibility.choice1: Directing user focus on particular elements
Accessibility.choice2: Limiting the focus area of a webpage

Accessibility.question: Why is providing text alternatives for non-text content important in web accessibility?
Accessibility.choice1: To replace non-text content with text
Accessibility.choice3: To ensure content is accessible to people with disabilities
Accessibility.choice4: To reduce the size of webpages
